intro: Elaphoglossum tragiifolium, commonly known as the hairy-leaf holly fern, is a delicate fern native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds. The plant produces spores on the underside of its leaves, which are typically covered with a fine, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
